alert.note: Alert for Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southern Franklin; Western Clinton; Western Essex (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued April 17 at 3:39PM EDT until April 19 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation possible. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze possible. * WHERE...Southeastern St. Lawrence, Southern Franklin, Western Clinton and Western Essex Counties. * WHEN...From Monday evening through Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Rain is expected to mix with and change to heavy wet snow across the area early Tuesday morning and continue through much of the day before tapering off Tuesday evening. The highest snow totals are expected above 1500 feet with some freezing rain mixed in across the high peaks.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southern Franklin; Western Clinton; Western Essex
